showScoreExcerpt:
“The Cottage unfolds in a Cloud-Cuckoo Land where upper-middle-class characters run around drawing rooms in their underwear, solicitors' secretaries give away their employers' whereabouts to total strangers, and lavish country homes -- despite the title, this cottage could accommodate the cast of Downton Abbey -- apparently require the services of no servants whatsoever. It's a tasteless, anything-goes enterprise that, ruthlessly milking its often-coarse comic bits, gives artifice a bad name.”
